verb.description: Challenge (a judge, prosecutor, or juror) as unqualified to perform legal duties because of a possible conflict of interest or lack of impartiality.
examples: a motion to recuse the prosecutor

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense reject, specifically object to a judge as prejudiced): from Latin recusare to refuse, from re- (expressing opposition) + causa a cause. The current sense dates from the early 19th century.
